title: Ascended_Intellect
author: Ascended_Intellect
content: Hello Everyone,I hope you are all well, slightly longer post than usual.As the title suggests I would enjoy to hear:1 hill you'll die on regarding the future of BTC1 common delusion you've seen related to BTC1 piece of advice that you wish you got told sooner relating to any BTC variable[UNRELATED BELOW, ASSORTMENT OF THOUGHTS]Questions are the metaphorical key to pandora's box but with every action there's an opposite force, in this case one answer could unlock subconscious treasure for an individual stuck in the box we call programming. Programmed since birth whether that is from parents relating to lessons they've received from generations passed or the indoctrination of the education system, I could go on an endless tangent about the capability cap one puts on his or hers self relating to the coding they've subconsciously downloaded from whatever the source may be but I will turn the key to open my next point.Limitations relating to one's potential is common & accepted due to the fear of trying something new, being with the blanket of comfort while not entertaining the idea of going into the cold unknown draws parallel to BTC, those who are opposed to this market have the perception of everything being pitch black but don't realise that BTC can be the light leading to eventual clarity & comfort. Why limit oneself in avenues connected to financial stability & or freedom, there is the argument of balance with there needs to be the average, the talker & or the cowardly to highlight the excellence, the doers & the brave.The connection to oneself could be described as connecting cognitive capabilities to the centre crevouses of cured slow aged growth

comments.author: pinggoki
comments.body: My brother in Christ, I don't want to know if you've used AI in your post cause I'm too lazy right now to check it but if you don't, you probably could've used some help making your post a little bit more understandable for other people because you're not going to be getting your point across many people and it wouldn't be worth talking over if you don't make it coherent for everyone of us. I hope you wouldn't mind or take it hard with my criticism, really want to help you out. You can also focus on posting in your local language board, who knows, you might be able to learn more there and you can communicate much easier there.Make it make sense, your post I mean.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: Quote from: pinggoki on March 27, 2024, 04:38:56 AM you probably could've used some help making your post a little bit more understandable for other people I think OP is trying to live up to their name. Alright to your question,  I don't understand the first so would skip. The second I would say to the Bitcoin supporters one delusion I find is it's going to replace Fiat currency,  To me they are going to complement the short comings of the other.  And to the Anti Bitcoiners (ignorant one) is that Bitcoin is just a digital currency, when it is in fact something more. To the last question, it would be always Buy the dip and never sell the Dip.Apriori Bitcoin would always recover from any fall.

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: This topic is strange. I don't understand the purpose behind it.At the same time the language used is very allegorical and it confuses users.I think that you should focus on writing more constructive posts, because after all, you are wasting your own time.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: The title is funny, the content as well are laughable and confusing as also, i expect you OP to first be the one to leave by example and start the answering of the 111 you have asked, to me, this topic is not carry a more ideal pattern in which was stated from here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=102944.msg1128795#msg1128795 then you're too grammatical in your construction, you can sometimes have to come down to using the easy and simple words in making an expression than the use of grammatical words being more confusing in making your expressions.

comments.author: letteredhub
comments.body: Quote from: apogio on March 27, 2024, 09:17:56 AMThis topic is strange. I don't understand the purpose behind it.At the same time the language used is very allegorical and it confuses users.I think that you should focus on writing more constructive posts, because after all, you are wasting your own time. I believe the title of the post and the post itself was written with the sole aim of confusing it readers not to gain any significant idea about whatever message it's giving, that's if actually it's giving any message by the way. Apart from BTC that was made mentioned in the post all other writings sounds philosophical but with a loose body of message that seems to be a real waste of time after reading.Op you can do better than this.

comments.author: Uhwuchukwu53
comments.body: Quote from: apogio on March 27, 2024, 09:17:56 AMThis topic is strange. I don't understand the purpose behind it.At the same time the language used is very allegorical and it confuses users.I think that you should focus on writing more constructive posts, because after all, you are wasting your own time.I thought only me found it difficult to comprehend but your on same part with me, op is deraying from passing a good information as many found it hard to understand even the topic 111 I don't know the algorithm either is done by AI let him go through the post and explain that we may understand.Note op time waste can be regain, going through this post without anything to learn is not encouraging.

comments.author: Ascended_Intellect
comments.body: Hello All!Apologies for the confusion caused 1 hill you'll die on regarding the future of BTC - BTC will be shake investment firms, wherever the money is these cut throat firms will follow with action 1 common delusion you've seen related to BTC - That BTC will challenge existing currencies1 piece of advice that you wish you got told sooner relating to any BTC variable - Patience with portfolio growth  Noticed the criticism of my assortment of thoughts which is welcome, constructive feedback relating to my writing style will aid me greatly in improving!

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: 1Hill:Bitcoin will never be displaced in my lifetime and that of the generation after me. Altcoins won't give up trying, vainglorious Web3/decentralisation technologists will sneer, but Bitcoin will be the only one with little to prove.1Common delusion:Mass adoption will be tens of millions "using" Bitcoin.1Advice:I wish someone told me to climb my hill sooner.P.S. Poor OP, your allegories are lost on the crowd, you know you're fighting a losing battle when the first response means less than yours, and demands more sense than yours.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Hello, you have created a topic that's of no use and that's why I recommend you to create a good topic next time so users can interact with you by sharing their valuable knowledge. I'll answer only one question of yours that the 2nd one. One common delusion that I've seen about Bitcoin is that it will go zero in value and that's the most delusionary thing about it which some skeptics promote.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: For me, the answer to “common delusion you've seen related to BTC ” is that Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies are a way to get rich quickly and achieve dreams by simply investing small amounts and without getting tired or making any effort.The second delusion is that Bitcoin is the cause of all the problems and losses that occurred in Crypto. For example, I saw some people who did not know anything about Bitcoin think that Bitcoin was the cause of the FTX incident and the loss of millions of dollars to people.
